SEARCH
Package com.serezk4.io.socket.server

Class Server.ClientData

java.lang.Object
com.serezk4.io.socket.server.Server.ClientData
Enclosing class:
Server
private static class Server.ClientData extends Object
A container for client-specific data used during communication with the server.

This class encapsulates the client's read buffer and a write queue for storing outgoing responses. It provides methods for accessing these buffers and for queuing responses to be sent to the client.

Thread Safety:

The ConcurrentLinkedQueue ensures that the write queue is thread-safe and can be accessed by multiple threads concurrently without additional synchronization.

  • Method Details

    • getReadBuffer

      public ByteBuffer getReadBuffer()
      Retrieves the read buffer for this client.

      The read buffer is used to temporarily store incoming data from the client before it is processed. It is allocated with a size defined by BUFFER_SIZE.

      Returns:
      the ByteBuffer used for reading data.

    • getWriteQueue

      public Queue<ByteBuffer> getWriteQueue()
      Retrieves the write queue for this client.

      The write queue holds ByteBuffer objects representing responses to be sent to the client. Responses are added to this queue and processed sequentially during write operations.

      Returns:
      the Queue of ByteBuffer objects to be written.

    • queueResponse

      public void queueResponse(Response response)
      Queues a response to be sent to the client.

      This method serializes the given Response object, wraps the serialized data in a ByteBuffer, and adds it to the client's write queue. The buffer includes the length of the serialized data as a 4-byte integer at the beginning.

      Workflow:

      • The Response object is serialized to a byte array.
      • A ByteBuffer is created with enough capacity to hold the serialized data and its length.
      • The length of the data is added to the buffer, followed by the data itself.
      • The buffer is flipped to prepare it for writing, and it is added to the write queue.
      Parameters:
      response - the Response object to be queued for the client.
